page.title: 16Ridlington Church, Rutland
page.content: Ridlington church is situated in the central area of the village overlooking a side of a hill. It is the junction of two roads coming together at the north side of the church and the graveyard may be entered by a small iron gate at that corner. The church as it stands today is very well looked after with flowers and holly bushes at the south entrance and the grass surrounding some 200 graves is frequently cut.But before the 1860's there were{"large rents and fissures} {in the chancel,occasioned by a doorway {having been cut in a reckless way in } {the south wall."}In the year 1860 Henry Parsons ,a London architect,was called in to advise and Halliday of Greetham was employed to do the restoration work.
